operations.specification:
This API operation allows unauthenticated guest users to register an account with limited access and obtain temporary tokens for accessing public information. It is associated with the auction_platform_guests table, which stores guest user identities including email and optional nickname along with timestamps and soft deletion. This operation creates a new guest record with a unique email and optional nickname, generating initial temporary JWT tokens to manage guest sessions. Access is public, requiring no prior authentication.

The join operation requires the email field for uniqueness and optional nickname for display purposes. The created_at, updated_at, and deleted_at fields manage lifecycle states but are handled internally. The join operation ensures that the email is unique and valid for guest identification.

Related operations include refresh token renewal to extend guest sessions using valid refresh tokens.

Security considerations include ensuring that the operation does not allow privilege escalation beyond guest access and protects against duplicate registrations with the same email.

This operation is intended as a registration and initial token issuance point for guests, part of the role-specific authentication flow for guests, in line with the role kind "guest".
operations.description:
Creates a new guest account for unauthenticated users with limited access rights. Stores guest email and optional nickname, with lifecycle timestamps. Issues temporary JWT tokens to manage guest sessions and access levels. Uniqueness of email is enforced to prevent duplicate guest registrations.

This operation corresponds to the auction_platform_guests table, referencing fields: email (unique), nickname (optional), created_at, updated_at, deleted_at.

Guest users cannot perform login as they do not authenticate with credentials but can refresh tokens for continued access.

Related: refresh operation to renew token access.

Ensures security by restricting guest token scope to limited permissions only.

The endpoint is public and does not require authentication.

It is part of the essential operations for the guest role kind.

Functionally, the operation receives a valid refresh token from the guest user and issues new temporary access tokens with extended expiration. It corresponds to the authentication flow for guests who do not have login capabilities but require continued access via token renewal.

This operation maintains security by validating the refresh token and limiting token scope appropriately to guest access levels.

The endpoint is accessible only to guests presenting a valid refresh token.

Related to the join operation where the initial tokens are issued.

The role kind "guest" strictly forbids login operations, so refresh is the primary token renewal mechanism.

Request and response bodies conform to the standard pattern for refresh token operations in this context.

This operation is essential for the guest role kind authentication lifecycle.

refreshable_until.description:
Refresh token expiration timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string indicating the latest time until which the
refresh token can be used to obtain new access tokens.

IAuthorizationToken.description:
Authorization token response structure.

This interface defines the structure of the authorization token response
returned after successful user authentication. It contains both access and
refresh tokens along with their expiration information.

This token structure is automatically included in API schemas when the system
detects authorization roles in the requirements analysis phase. It provides a
standard format for JWT-based authentication across the generated backend
applications.

search.description: Filter string to search API integrations

active.description: Filter active status of the API integration

IAuctionPlatformApiIntegrations.IRequest.description: Parameters for filtering, sorting, and paginating auction platform API integration records.

id.description:
Primary key UUID of the API integration record.

Uniquely identifies the integration configuration.

name.description:
Unique name of the external API integration.

This name identifies the integration.

api_key.description:
API key or token used for authentication with the external service.

This field should be kept secure and not exposed in responses.

endpoint_url.description:
Base URL endpoint of the external API service.

Can be very long (up to 80000 characters).

active.description:
Flag indicating if this integration is currently active.

True means integration is enabled.

created_at.description:
Timestamp representing when this integration was created.

ISO 8601 formatted date-time string with timezone.

updated_at.description:
Timestamp representing when this integration was last updated.

ISO 8601 formatted date-time string with timezone.

deleted_at.description:
Optional timestamp for soft deletion.

Null if the record is active and not deleted.

IAuctionPlatformApiIntegrations.description:
Represents an external API integration configuration for the auction platform.

Includes API keys, endpoint URLs, and activation status. Supports auditing timestamps and soft deletion for lifecycle management.

name.description: Unique name for the new API integration.

api_key.description: API key or secret token for accessing the external service.

endpoint_url.description: Endpoint URL of the external API.

active.description: Boolean flag to mark the integration as active or inactive.

IAuctionPlatformApiIntegrations.ICreate.description:
Request schema for creating a new Auction Platform API integration.

Clients must provide all required fields: unique name, api key, endpoint URL, and active status.

This schema excludes auditing timestamps and IDs as those are generated by the system.

name.description:
Updated name of the API integration.
Optional and nullable for partial updates.

api_key.description:
Updated API key or token.
Optional and nullable to allow unsetting.

endpoint_url.description:
Updated endpoint URL.
Optional and nullable for partial updates.

active.description:
Updated active status flag.
Optional and nullable.

IAuctionPlatformApiIntegrations.IUpdate.description:
Request schema for updating an existing Auction Platform API integration.

All fields are optional and nullable to support partial updates.

Includes properties for name, api_key, endpoint_url, and active status with null allowed to unset or indicate no change.

component_name.description: Optional filter for component name search.

limit.description: Optional limit of records per page.

min_requests_per_minute.description: Optional minimum requests per minute filter.

max_requests_per_minute.description: Optional maximum requests per minute filter.

IAuctionPlatformRateLimit.IRequest.description:
Request schema for searching and filtering Auction Platform rate limits.

Supports pagination and filtering by component name and requests per minute range.

All properties are optional to allow flexible query criteria.

id.description: Unique identifier for this rate limit record.

component_name.description: Name of the component this rate limit applies to, unique across the system.

max_requests_per_minute.description: Maximum number of requests allowed per minute for the component.

max_requests_per_hour.description: Maximum number of requests allowed per hour for the component.

max_requests_per_day.description: Maximum number of requests allowed per day for the component.

created_at.description: Timestamp when this record was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when this record was last updated.

deleted_at.description: Soft delete timestamp; null if not deleted.

IAuctionPlatformRateLimit.description: Auction Platform Rate Limit interface represents a policy defining limits on request frequency to various components. It includes unique component name and maximum request thresholds per minute, hour, and day. This interface corresponds to the 'auction_platform_rate_limits' table in the database.

component_name.description: Name of the component to assign the rate limit to.

max_requests_per_minute.description: Maximum requests per minute allowed for component.

max_requests_per_hour.description: Maximum requests per hour allowed for component.

max_requests_per_day.description: Maximum requests per day allowed for component.

IAuctionPlatformRateLimit.ICreate.description: Data required to create a new auction platform rate limit record. Must include component_name and max request thresholds. Created and updated timestamps managed by the system; id and deleted_at are omitted here.

id.description: Unique identifier of the rate limit record.

component_name.description: Component name governed by this rate limit.

created_at.description: Creation timestamp.

updated_at.description: Last update timestamp.

deleted_at.description: Soft deletion timestamp; null if record is active.

IAuctionPlatformAuctionPlatformRateLimit.description: Update payload for the auction platform rate limits entity. Allows modifying component name and max request thresholds. Does not include create timestamps or soft delete field.

max_requests_per_minute.description: Max requests per minute allowed after update.

max_requests_per_hour.description: Max requests per hour allowed after update.

max_requests_per_day.description: Max requests per day allowed after update.

IAuctionPlatformAuctionPlatformRateLimit.description: Properties allowed for updating a rate limit record. All fields except id and timestamps are required for update.

limit.description: Limitation of records per a page.

user_id.description: Reference to system user performing the action, if applicable.

action.description: Description of the performed action or event.

date_to.description: End datetime filter for audit logs.

id.description:
Primary Key.

Unique identifier of the auction room in UUID format.

streamer_name.description:
Name of the streamer who owns this auction room.

Used to identify the auction room by streamer's unique name.

start_time.description:
Scheduled start time of the auction room.

ISO 8601 date-time string representing when the auction begins.

end_time.description:
Optional scheduled end time of the auction room.

ISO 8601 date-time string or null if no end time is specified.

status.description:
Status of the auction room.

A value such as "open", "closed", "pending" representing auction lifecycle state.

created_at.description:
Record creation timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string when the record was created.

updated_at.description:
Record last updated timestamp.

ISO 8601 date-time string when the record was last updated.

deleted_at.description:
Soft delete timestamp for marking deletion.

ISO 8601 date-time string or null if not deleted.

IAuctionPlatformAuctionRoom.description:
Auction room information managed per streamer with schedule data and
auction lifecycle status. This entity tracks start/end times, status, and
auditing timestamps.

streamer_name.description:
Filter by streamer name substring search.

Nullable for optional filtering.

status.description:
Filter by status substring search.

Nullable for optional filtering.

start_time_gte.description:
Filter by start time minimum (inclusive).

ISO 8601 date-time format.
Nullable to allow no lower bound.

start_time_lte.description:
Filter by start time maximum (inclusive).

ISO 8601 date-time format.
Nullable to allow no upper bound.

end_time_gte.description:
Filter by end time minimum (inclusive).

ISO 8601 date-time format.
Nullable for optional filtering.

end_time_lte.description:
Filter by end time maximum (inclusive).

ISO 8601 date-time format.
Nullable.

page.description:
Pagination parameters: page number.

Unsigned 32-bit integer.
Nullable.

limit.description:
Pagination parameters: number of records per page.

Unsigned 32-bit integer.
Nullable.

sort.description:
Sort by multiple fields with direction - can be comma separated list.
Nullable. Example: "start_time:desc,status:asc"

IAuctionPlatformAuctionRoom.IRequest.description: Request schema for filtering, searching, pagination and sorting auction rooms.

streamer_name.description:
Name of the streamer who owns this auction room.

Mandatory for creating a new auction room.

start_time.description:
Scheduled start time of the auction room.

Mandatory ISO 8601 date-time string.

end_time.description:
Optional scheduled end time of the auction room.

ISO 8601 date-time string or null if no end time is specified.

status.description:
Status of the auction room.

Mandatory string state such as "open", "closed", or "pending".

start_time.description:
Scheduled start time of the auction room.

Optional ISO 8601 date-time string.

end_time.description:
Optional scheduled end time of the auction room.

ISO 8601 date-time string or null.

status.description:
Status of the auction room.

Optional string state such as "open", "closed", or "pending".

IAuctionPlatformAuctionRoom.IUpdate.description: Request body for updating an auction room.

page.description:
Page number.

Pagination page index, unsigned integer.

limit.description:
Limitation of records per a page.

Default is 100 if not specified.

Sorting option.

Possible values might be: "nickname_asc", "nickname_desc", "created_at_asc", "created_at_desc".

IAuctionPlatformAuctionCandidates.IReque.description: Request body for searching auction candidates with pagination, filtering and sorting.

Primary Key.

Identifier referencing the member user who is the auction candidate.

IAuctionPlatformAuctionCandidate.description:
Auction candidate entity representing registered users as auction candidates.

Includes user association, nickname, performance stats, and audit timestamps.

user_id.description:
Identifier referencing the member user who is the auction candidate.

Required for creation; must be a valid UUID.

nickname.description:
Candidate's display nickname in auctions.

Required for creation.

season_stats.description:
Serialized or JSON string holding game season statistics.

Optional; can be null.

IAuctionPlatformAuctionCandidate.ICreate.description:
Request schema for creating a new auction candidate.

Requires user_id and nickname, optional season stats.

nickname.description:
Candidate's display nickname in auctions.

Optional; can be null.

season_stats.description:
Serialized or JSON string holding game season statistics.

Optional; can be null.

Request schema for updating an auction candidate.

Only nickname and season stats can be modified.

page.description:
Page number for pagination.

Optional; if null, the default page is 1.

limit.description:
Limit of records per page.

Optional; if null, default limit is applied.

Optional; can be null for no filtering.

Minimum available points filter.

maxAvailablePoints.description:

Optional; can be null.

IAuctionPlatformTeamLeader.IRequest.description:
Request schema for querying auction team leaders.

Includes pagination and filtering by nickname and available points.

id.description:
Primary Key.

Unique identifier for the team leader.

member_id.description:
References the member user who is the team leader.

Maps to auction_platform_members.id.

available_points.description:
Points currently available for auction bidding by the team leader.

This value represents the total points the team leader can allocate for bidding in auctions.

created_at.description: Creation timestamp for team leader record.

updated_at.description: Last update timestamp for team leader record.

IAuctionPlatformTeamLeader.description:
Represents a team leader participating in auctions with point allocation and profile linkage to member users.

Corresponds to the auction_platform_team_leaders table in the database.

Properties include unique ID, member linkage, available bidding points, and audit timestamps.

References the member user who is the team leader. Must link to existing member.

Required for team leader creation.

available_points.description:
Points initially available for bidding when creating the team leader.

This field is typically initialized by the system.

IAuctionPlatformTeamLeaders.ICreate.description: Request type for creating a new auction team leader with required member association and initial bidding points. Does not accept IDs or timestamps as these are auto-generated.

member_id.description:
References the member user who is the team leader.

Usually not updatable, included as optional.

available_points.description:
Points currently available for auction bidding by the team leader.

Optional for update operations.

IAuctionPlatformTeamLeaders.IUpdate.description: Request type for updating an existing auction team leader record. Fields are optional to allow partial updates. Member association is generally immutable but can be optionally updated as per business rules.

id.description:
Primary Key.

Unique identifier for the team leader.

member_id.description:
References the member user who is the team leader.

Maps to auction_platform_members.id.

available_points.description:
Points currently available for auction bidding by the team leader.

This value represents the total points the team leader can allocate for bidding in auctions.

updated_at.description: Last update timestamp for team leader record.

IAuctionPlatformTeamLeaders.description:
Represents a team leader participating in auctions with point allocation and profile linkage to member users.

Corresponds to the auction_platform_team_leaders table in the database.

team_leader_id.description: UUID of the team leader making the bid

IAuctionPlatformPointBalances.IRequest.description:
Request type for searching and paginating auction platform point balances.
Supports optional pagination, search text, complex filter conditions, and sorting options.

Includes:
- `page`: pagination page number, zero or positive integer
- `limit`: number of records per page, positive integer
- `search`: general text search, nullable to disable
- `filter`: detailed conditions on team leader ID, auction room ID, points allocated and used range
- `orderBy`: specification of field and direction for sorting

All properties are optional and nullable to allow flexible queries.

page.description: Page number for pagination; zero or positive integer.

limit.description: Limit of records per page; positive integer.

search.description: General search text; can be null to disable.

oneOf.description: Filter conditions for auction platform point balances.

filter.description: Filter conditions for auction platform point balances.

IAuctionPlatformPointBalance.description: Detailed record representing auction points allocated and used by a team leader within a specific auction room.

id.description: Unique identifier for auction platform point balance record.

team_leader_id.description: UUID of the team leader this point balance belongs to.

auction_room_id.description: UUID of the auction room associated with this point balance.

points_allocated.description: Total auction points allocated to the team leader.

points_used.description: Total auction points that the team leader has spent.

created_at.description: Timestamp when the point balance was created.

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the point balance record was last updated.

IAuctionPlatformPointBalance.ICreate.description: Request body for creating a new auction platform point balance record.

team_leader_id.description: UUID reference to the team leader to allocate points to.

auction_room_id.description: UUID reference to the auction room associated with the allocation.

points_allocated.description: Number of auction points allocated to the team leader for bidding.

points_used.description: Number of auction points already used by the team leader.

IAuctionPlatformPointBalance.IUpdate.description: Request body for updating an existing auction platform point balance record. All fields are optional and nullable.

team_leader_id.description: Optional updated UUID reference to a team leader.

auction_room_id.description: Optional updated UUID reference to an auction room.

points_allocated.description: Optional updated total of auction points allocated.

points_used.description: Optional updated total of auction points used.

message_search.description:
Filter chat messages containing this substring.

@nullable

IAuctionPlatformChatMessage.IRequest.description:
Request schema for searching and paginating chat messages.

Includes filters by auction room, team leader, message content, date ranges, etc.

auction_platform_auction_room_id.description:
Foreign key to auction room id where the chat is posted.

@format uuid

Foreign key to team leader posting this message.

Auction room ID where this chat message belongs.

@format uuid

@format uuid

Contains necessary foreign keys and message content.
Fields id, created_at, updated_at, deleted_at are system managed.

Payload to update existing chat message.

All fields optional to allow partial update except id which is path param.

oneOf.description: Filter by donor name (partial match supported).

oneOf.description: Sort order: e.g. "created_at DESC" or "donation_amount ASC".

order_by.description: Sort order: e.g. "created_at DESC" or "donation_amount ASC".

IAuctionPlatformSponsorshipEvent.IReques.description: Filter parameters for paginated retrieval of sponsorship events.

id.description:
Primary Key.

Unique identifier for the sponsorship event record.

Related auction room ID.

References auction_platform_auction_rooms.id. Identifies the auction room where the event occurred.

Associated member (team leader) ID.
